DOC.detailed_description: EBV-infection well-known trigger CFS . A closely related research project ( Chronic fatigue follow acute Epstein-Barr virus infection Adolescents ; ClinicalTrials ID : NCT02335437 ) combine prospective cross-sectional study 200 adolescent suffer acute EBV infection . The primary aim study identify factor predispose CFS 6 month acute infection . Thus , project provide sample thoroughly characterized CFS patient , precipitation factor ( EBV-infection ) . The present project intervention trial subgroup patient actually develop CFS 6 month acute EBV infection . Patients randomise 1:1 either mental training program ( 10 session ) combine element cognitive behavioral therapy music therapy , routine follow-up general practitioner . By nature , treatment group allocation blind ; however , patient therapist blind end-point evaluation . An extensive investigational program carry three time point : Prior intervention , immediately intervention , 1 year intervention . The program include : Clinical examination ; Pain threshold assessment ; Cardiovascular assessment ; Cognitive assessment ; Sampling biological material ( blood urine ) ; Questionnaire ; Brain fMRI ; Qualitative interview ; Monitoring physical activity ( accelerometer )
